name: Abandon Hope
text: As an additional cost to cast Abandon Hope, discard X cards.\nLook at target opponent's hand and choose X cards from it. That player discards those cards.
flavor: As Gerrard's form vanished into the maw of trees, Hanna mouthed a silent plea, mourning a crushed dream.

name: Advance Scout
text: First strike\n{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor: "The soldier's path is worn smooth by the tread of many feet—all in one direction, none returning."\n—Oracle en-Vec

name: Aftershock
text: Destroy target artifact, creature, or land. Aftershock deals 3 damage to you.
flavor: "Every act of destruction has a repercussion."\n—Karn, silver golem

name: Altar of Dementia
text: Sacrifice a creature: Target player puts a number of cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
flavor: "It is not that you will go mad. It is that you will beg for madness."\n—Volrath

name: Aluren
text: Any player may play creature cards with converted mana cost 3 or less without paying their mana cost and as though they had flash.
flavor: Squee bounced up and down. "I sees a horsey, an' a piggy, an' a—"\n"If you don't shut up," hissed Mirri, "you'll see a kidney and a spleeny."

name: Ancient Runes
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Ancient Runes deals damage to that player equal to the number of artifacts he or she controls.
flavor: Ertai volunteered to open the portal. He figured he owed it one.

name: Ancient Tomb
text: {T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool. Ancient Tomb deals 2 damage to you.
flavor: There is no glory to be gained in the kingdom of the dead.\n—Vec tomb inscription

name: Angelic Protector
text: Flying\nWhenever Angelic Protector becomes the target of a spell or ability, Angelic Protector gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
flavor: "My family sheltered in her light, the dark was content to wait."\n—Crovax

name: Anoint
text: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nPrevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

name: Apes of Rath
text: Whenever Apes of Rath attacks, it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
flavor: Monkeys three, monkeys through.

name: Apocalypse
text: Exile all permanents. You discard your hand.
flavor: "There is a future in which I can see only mist and a single shadow."\n—Oracle en-Vec

name: Armor Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn."
flavor: Hanna: "We must learn how they protect each other."\nMirri: "After they've done trying to kill us, all right?"

name: Armored Pegasus
text: Flying
flavor: "I always charge a little extra to take on a pegasus. They fly like eagles, kick like mules, and hide like hermits."\n—Tahli en-Dal, bounty hunter

name: Auratog
text: Sacrifice an enchantment: Auratog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: The auratog enjoys eating its wards.

name: Avenging Angel
text: Flying\nWhen Avenging Angel dies, you may put it on top of its owner's library.

name: Barbed Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
flavor: Spans of spines leapt from one sliver to the next, forming a deadly hedge around the Weatherlight.

name: Bayou Dragonfly
text: Flying; swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: "Like a sugar stick with wings!"\n—Squee, goblin cabin hand

name: Bellowing Fiend
text: Flying\nWhenever Bellowing Fiend deals damage to a creature, Bellowing Fiend deals 3 damage to that creature's controller and 3 damage to you.

name: Benthic Behemoth
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor:
"Deep devourer   concealed in darkhome
Shrouded it seeks   all becomes fodder
Once we swam   alone and asea
But no more."
—Rootwater Saga

name: Blood Frenzy
text: Cast Blood Frenzy only before the combat damage step.\nTarget attacking or blocking creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: "When Torahn bellows, none survive—not even the warrior whose horns he rides."\n—Talruum adage

name: Blood Pet
text: Sacrifice Blood Pet: Add {B} to your mana pool.
flavor: "You are wrong," Volrath said. "I do not hate the living. They often prove quite useful to me." And then he laughed.

name: Boil
text: Destroy all Islands.
flavor: "The fishers will throw out their nets and draw them back filled with dust."\n—Oracle en-Vec

name: Booby Trap
text: As Booby Trap enters the battlefield, name a card other than a basic land card and choose an opponent.\nThe chosen player reveals each card he or she draws.\nWhen the chosen player draws the named card, sacrifice Booby Trap. If you do, Booby Trap deals 10 damage to that player.

name: Bottle Gnomes
text: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.
flavor: "I am reminded of the fable of the silver egg. Its owner cracks it open to see what jewels it holds, only to discover a simple yellow yolk."\n—Karn, silver golem

name: Bounty Hunter
text: {T}: Put a bounty counter on target nonblack creature.\n{T}: Destroy target creature with a bounty counter on it.
flavor: "Once they've marked you," Starke said, "the world is made of glass."

name: Broken Fall
text: Return Broken Fall to its owner's hand: Regenerate target creature.
flavor: "I think I used up all my good luck and all my bad luck in the same fall."\n—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Caldera Lake
text: Caldera Lake enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool. Caldera Lake deals 1 damage to you.

name: Canopy Spider
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: "We know our place in the cycle of life—and it is not as flies."\n—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Canyon Drake
text: Flying\n{1}, Discard a card at random: Canyon Drake gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "These runes are tough enough without the distraction," Ertai muttered, one eye on the drake.

name: Canyon Wildcat
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor: "Relative of yours?" Ertai teased. Mirri simply sneered.

name: Capsize
text: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nReturn target permanent to its owner's hand.

name: Carrionette
text: {2}{B}{B}: Exile Carrionette and target creature unless that creature's controller pays {2}. Activate this ability only if Carrionette is in your graveyard.

name: Chaotic Goo
text: Chaotic Goo enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, you may flip a coin. If you win the flip, put a +1/+1 counter on Chaotic Goo. If you lose the flip, remove a +1/+1 counter from Chaotic Goo.

name: Charging Rhino
text: Charging Rhino can't be blocked by more than one creature.
flavor: "Is it wrong to go straight for what you want? Sneaking is for cats and goblins."\n—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

name: Chill
text: Red spells cost {2} more to cast.
flavor: "Temper, temper."\n—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Choke
text: Islands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
flavor: "One day we shall walk where once was water."\n—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Cinder Marsh
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Cinder Marsh doesn't untap during your next untap step.

name: Circle of Protection: Black
text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: Blue
text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: Green
text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: Red
text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: Shadow
text: {1}: The next time a creature of your choice with shadow would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: White
text: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Clergy en-Vec
text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
flavor: "Faith's shield is hammered out by the blows of unbelievers."\n—Oracle en-Vec

name: Clot Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{2}: Regenerate this permanent."
flavor: "One would think I would be accustomed to unexpected returns."\n—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

name: Cloudchaser Eagle
text: Flying\nWhen Cloudchaser Eagle enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
flavor: When the eagle catches a cloud, it tears it into strips that fall to earth.\n—Vec myth of the rains

name: Coercion
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor: "There's very little that escapes me, Greven. And you will escape very little if you fail."\n—Volrath

name: Coffin Queen
text: You may choose not to untap Coffin Queen during your untap step.\n{2}{B}, {T}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. When Coffin Queen becomes untapped or you lose control of Coffin Queen, exile that creature.

name: Coiled Tinviper
text: First strike
flavor: The bite of the tinviper feels most like a razor drawn across the tongue.

name: Cold Storage
text: {3}: Exile target creature you control.\nSacrifice Cold Storage: Return each creature card exiled with Cold Storage to the battlefield under your control.

name: Commander Greven il-Vec
text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)\nWhen Commander Greven il-Vec enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
flavor: "Rage is the only freedom left me."\n—Greven il-Vec

name: Corpse Dance
text: Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nReturn the top creature card of your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste until end of turn. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Counterspell
text: Counter target spell.
flavor: "It was probably a lousy spell in the first place."\n—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Crazed Armodon
text: {G}: Crazed Armodon gets +3/+0 and gains trample until end of turn. Destroy Crazed Armodon at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only once each turn.
flavor: These are its last days. Mourning is over. Rage remains.

name: Crown of Flames
text: Enchant creature\n{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.\n{R}: Return Crown of Flames to its owner's hand.
flavor: It is the forge of kings.

name: Cursed Scroll
text: {3}, {T}: Name a card. Reveal a card at random from your hand. If it's the named card, Cursed Scroll deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

name: Dark Banishing
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: "It is the way of most wizards to begin by exiling themselves and to end by exiling everyone else."\n—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

name: Dark Ritual
text: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
flavor: "If there is such a thing as too much power, I have not discovered it."\n—Volrath

name: Darkling Stalker
text: {B}: Regenerate Darkling Stalker.\n{B}: Darkling Stalker gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "In this dark place, yes, I am afraid of my own shadow."\n—Mirri of the Weatherlight

name: Dauthi Embrace
text: {B}{B}: Target creature gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor: "The Dauthi army grows by screams and bounds."\n—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Dauthi Ghoul
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nWhenever a creature with shadow dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Dauthi Ghoul.

name: Dauthi Horror
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nDauthi Horror can't be blocked by white creatures.

name: Dauthi Marauder
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor: "The Dauthi came from beneath the Ruins one night, and the darkness cast them in the best possible light."\n—Soltari Tales of Life

name: Dauthi Mercenary
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\n{1}{B}: Dauthi Mercenary gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "The Dauthi believe they dignify murder by paying for it."\n—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Dauthi Mindripper
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nWhenever Dauthi Mindripper attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, defending player discards three cards.

name: Dauthi Slayer
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nDauthi Slayer attacks each turn if able.
flavor: "They have knives for every soul."\n—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Deadshot
text: Tap target creature. It deals damage equal to its power to another target creature.
flavor: "Carrion! Keep your distance. My blade will come to you!"\n—Crovax

name: Death Pits of Rath
text: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: As the sludge below began to shift and take shapes, Gerrard turned from the railing to Orim. "I suppose," he said, "it's a little too late for prayer, isn't it?"

name: Diabolic Edict
text: Target player sacrifices a creature.
flavor: Greven il-Vec lifted Vhati off his feet. "The fall will give you time to think on your failure."

name: Dirtcowl Wurm
text: Whenever an opponent plays a land, put a +1/+1 counter on Dirtcowl Wurm.
flavor: Few of Rath's rivers follow a steady course, so many new channels are carved for them.

name: Disenchant
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor: The swarm seemed unmoved by the artificial slivers' destruction. "They clearly were not the leaders," Hanna cursed. "I guess we'll have to do this the hard way."

name: Dismiss
text: Counter target spell.\nDraw a card.
flavor: "There is nothing you can do that I cannot simply deny."\n—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Disturbed Burial
text: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nReturn target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Dracoplasm
text: Flying\nAs Dracoplasm enters the battlefield, sacrifice any number of creatures. Dracoplasm's power becomes the total power of those creatures and its toughness becomes their total toughness.\n{R}: Dracoplasm gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

name: Dread of Night
text: White creatures get -1/-1.
flavor: "These moonless, foreign skies keep me in thrall. Dark whispers echo in the night, and I cannot resist."\n—Selenia, dark angel

name: Dream Cache
text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand both on top of your library or both on the bottom of your library.
flavor: "The sanctity of poverty is an invention of the rich."\n—Starke

name: Dregs of Sorrow
text: Destroy X target nonblack creatures. Draw X cards.
flavor: Crovax gazed upon the dead, and for one dark moment he saw a banquet.

name: Duplicity
text:
When Duplicity enters the battlefield, exile the top five cards of your library face down.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile all cards from your hand face down. If you do, put all other cards you own exiled with Duplicity into your hand.
At the beginning of your end step, discard a card.
When you lose control of Duplicity, put all cards exiled with Duplicity into their owner's graveyard.

name: Earthcraft
text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Untap target basic land.
flavor: "The land gives up little, but we are masters of persuasion."\n—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Echo Chamber
text: {4}, {T}: An opponent chooses target creature he or she controls. Put a token that's a copy of that creature onto the battlefield. That token gains haste until end of turn. Exile the token at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

name: Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
text: Other Elf creatures have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)\nOther Elves have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
flavor: "We have been patient. We have planned our attack. We are ready . . . now."\n—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Eladamri's Vineyard
text: At the beginning of each player's precombat main phase, add {G}{G} to that player's mana pool.
flavor: The mushroom wine made Gerrard's head spin, and his stomach soon followed suit.

name: Elite Javelineer
text: Whenever Elite Javelineer blocks, it deals 1 damage to target attacking creature.
flavor: "Precision is frequently more valuable than force."\n—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Elven Warhounds
text: Whenever Elven Warhounds becomes blocked by a creature, put that creature on top of its owner's library.
flavor: "If a creature is dumb enough to love you for leashing it, why would you want to follow its lead?"\n—Mirri of the Weatherlight

name: Elvish Fury
text: Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nTarget creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

name: Emerald Medallion
text: Green spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

name: Emmessi Tome
text: {5}, {T}: Draw two cards, then discard a card.
flavor: It is like life and destiny: we think we know the story, but we have read only half the tale.

name: Endless Scream
text: Enchant creature\nEndless Scream enters the battlefield with X scream counters on it.\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each scream counter on Endless Scream.
flavor: "I have made Crovax weep; now I will make him scream. The pain will not end, but will bind him to me."\n—Volrath

name: Energizer
text: {2}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Energizer.
flavor: Like a kettle set to boil, it must eventually go off—on someone.

name: Enfeeblement
text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)\nEnchanted creature gets -2/-2.
flavor: Crovax had witnessed Selenia lead the Predator to the Weatherlight. As the battle raged on deck, he felt his strength melt in the heat of her betrayal.

name: Enraging Licid
text: {R}, {T}: Enraging Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {R} to end this effect.\nEnchanted creature has haste.

name: Ertai's Meddling
text: X can't be 0.\nTarget spell's controller exiles it with X delay counters on it.\nAt the beginning of each of that player's upkeeps, if that card is exiled, remove a delay counter from it. If the card has no delay counters on it, he or she puts it onto the stack as a copy of the original spell.

name: Escaped Shapeshifter
text: As long as an opponent controls a creature with flying not named Escaped Shapeshifter, Escaped Shapeshifter has flying. The same is true for first strike, trample, and protection from any color.

name: Essence Bottle
text: {3}, {T}: Put an elixir counter on Essence Bottle.\n{T}, Remove all elixir counters from Essence Bottle: You gain 2 life for each elixir counter removed this way.

name: Evincar's Justice
text: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nEvincar's Justice deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

name: Excavator
text: {T}, Sacrifice a basic land: Target creature gains landwalk of each of the land types of the sacrificed land until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a land of any of those types.)

name: Extinction
text: Destroy all creatures of the creature type of your choice.
flavor: "I once had an entire race killed just to listen to the rattling of their dried bones as I waded through them."\n—Volrath

name: Fevered Convulsions
text: {2}{B}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
flavor: "Tell me again why you failed to capture Gerrard, you worthless pile of spine."\n—Volrath, to Greven

name: Field of Souls
text: Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

name: Fighting Drake
text: Flying
flavor: Two things are needed to survive the harsh skies of Rath: a thick hide and a thicker skull.

name: Firefly
text: Flying\n{R}: Firefly gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "If they don't pinch, they burn. Can't ya eat any of da bugs here?"\n—Squee, goblin cabin hand

name: Fireslinger
text: {T}: Fireslinger deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.
flavor: "Remember the moral of the fireslinger fable: with power comes isolation."\n—Karn, silver golem

name: Flailing Drake
text: Flying\nWhenever Flailing Drake blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Too many choices will always distract a greedy beast.

name: Flickering Ward
text:
Enchant creature
As Flickering Ward enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Enchanted creature has protection from the chosen color. This effect doesn't remove Flickering Ward.
{W}: Return Flickering Ward to its owner's hand.

name: Flowstone Giant
text: {R}: Flowstone Giant gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
flavor: When the first of these giants woke from the bedrock, he was still sleepy. He yawned and stretched until his legs grew so thin that they snapped like icicles in the sun.\n—Vec lore

name: Flowstone Salamander
text: {R}: Flowstone Salamander deals 1 damage to target creature blocking it.
flavor: The Furnace of Rath is periodically illuminated by their sparkling yawns.

name: Flowstone Sculpture
text: {2}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Flowstone Sculpture or Flowstone Sculpture gains flying, first strike, or trample. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
flavor: The sculptor, weary of his work, created art that would finish itself.

name: Flowstone Wyvern
text: Flying\n{R}: Flowstone Wyvern gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
flavor: "Where I come from, stone stays on the ground."\n—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

name: Fool's Tome
text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you have no cards in hand.
flavor:
Squee: "What's that?"
Ertai: "It's a magical book."
Squee: "Am I smart enough ta use it?"
Ertai: "You could say that."

name: Frog Tongue
text: Enchant creature\nWhen Frog Tongue enters the battlefield, draw a card.\nEnchanted creature has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: "But why can't I get one?" sniveled Squee. "All da bugs here got wings."

name: Fugitive Druid
text: Whenever Fugitive Druid becomes the target of an Aura spell, you draw a card.
flavor: "If the druids are so devoted to their trees, I will carve them coffins from their precious heartwood."\n—Volrath

name: Furnace of Rath
text: If a source would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.

name: Fylamarid
text: Flying\nFylamarid can't be blocked by blue creatures.\n{U}: Target creature becomes blue until end of turn.

name: Gallantry
text: Target blocking creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.\nDraw a card.
flavor: "Forgive me," Mirri whispered. "I thought you a burden, and you saved my life." Hanna quietly accepted the apology.

name: Gaseous Form
text: Enchant creature\nPrevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
flavor: "It's hard to hurt anyone when you're as transparent as your motives."\n—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Gerrard's Battle Cry
text: {2}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: Gerrard grinned and drew his sword. "This won't be a fair fight," he called to his crew. "They should have brought a second ship!"

name: Ghost Town
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{0}: Return Ghost Town to its owner's hand. Activate this ability only if it's not your turn.
flavor: "The air here smells like a grave."\n—Crovax

name: Giant Crab
text: {U}: Giant Crab gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: During the giant crabs' mating season, Skyshroud nights are filled with the clatter of their skirmishes.

name: Giant Strength
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +2/+2.
flavor: "Crovax seems filled only with shadows," thought Orim. "Where does his strength come from?"

name: Goblin Bombardment
text: Sacrifice a creature: Goblin Bombardment deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: One mogg to aim the catapult, one mogg to steer the rock.

name: Gravedigger
text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

name: Grindstone
text: {3}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If both cards share a color, repeat this process.
flavor: "Memory is a burden that wears at the soul as weather wears at stone."\n—Crovax

name: Hand to Hand
text: During combat, players can't cast instant spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.
flavor: The match between Tahngarth and Greven was close only in the mind of the minotaur.

name: Hanna's Custody
text: All artifacts have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
flavor: "I protect the Legacy with my life if necessary, for its purpose is far more important than my own."\n—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

name: Harrow
text: As an additional cost to cast Harrow, sacrifice a land.\nSearch your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
flavor: Changing Rath's landscape is like tearing the scab from a wound.

name: Havoc
text: Whenever an opponent casts a white spell, he or she loses 2 life.
flavor: As Orim put the lightning rod into place on the bow, she cast a spell of protection to shield herself from the heat. That's when the Furnace got personal.

name: Heart Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have haste.
flavor: Gerrard looked all around for the source of the mysterious pulse, and at that moment the slivers boiled forth from the crevasses.

name: Heartwood Dryad
text: Heartwood Dryad can block creatures with shadow as though Heartwood Dryad had shadow.
flavor: To snare what lies between worlds takes the patient reach of trees.

name: Heartwood Giant
text: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Heartwood Giant deals 2 damage to target player.
flavor: Wind in the trees is soothing, but the same can't be said for trees on the wind.

name: Heartwood Treefolk
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: "In all my years in Llanowar I never understood where trees fit in. They are revered by elves and watered on by dogs."\n—Mirri of the Weatherlight

name: Helm of Possession
text: You may choose not to untap Helm of Possession during your untap step.\n{2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Gain control of target creature for as long as you control Helm of Possession and Helm of Possession remains tapped.

name: Hero's Resolve
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+5.
flavor: "Destiny, chance, fate, fortune—they're all just ways of claiming your successes without claiming your failures."\n—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Horned Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have trample.
flavor: A bristling wave of slivers broke against the Weatherlight's timbers.

name: Horned Turtle
flavor: "So like men are they: a hardened shell with fragile flesh beneath."\n—Selenia, dark angel

name: Humility
text: All creatures lose all abilities and have base power and toughness 1/1.
flavor: "One cannot cleanse the wounds of failure."\n—Karn, silver golem

name: Imps' Taunt
text: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nTarget creature attacks this turn if able.

name: Insight
text: Whenever an opponent casts a green spell, you draw a card.
flavor: "We can fight with you or against you. After my day, I'd prefer the former."\n—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Interdict
text: Counter target activated ability from an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land. That permanent's activated abilities can't be activated this turn. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)\nDraw a card.

name: Intuition
text: Search your library for three cards and reveal them. Target opponent chooses one. Put that card into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.

name: Invulnerability
text: Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nThe next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Jackal Pup
text: Whenever Jackal Pup is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to you.
flavor: The first morning after acquiring her familiar, the wizard awoke with fleabites and mange.

name: Jet Medallion
text: Black spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

name: Jinxed Idol
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Jinxed Idol deals 2 damage to you.\nSacrifice a creature: Target opponent gains control of Jinxed Idol.
flavor: "Here."

name: Kezzerdrix
text: First strike\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, if your opponents control no creatures, Kezzerdrix deals 4 damage to you.

name: Kindle
text: Kindle deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Kindle in all graveyards.
flavor: Hope of deliverance is scorched by the fire of futility.

name: Knight of Dawn
text: First strike\n{W}{W}: Knight of Dawn gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
flavor: Flash like daybreak to the fray.\n—Motto of the Knights of Dawn

name: Knight of Dusk
text: {B}{B}: Destroy target creature blocking Knight of Dusk.
flavor: Fall like night upon the foe.\n—Motto of the Knights of Dusk

name: Krakilin
text: Krakilin enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.\n{1}{G}: Regenerate Krakilin.
flavor: "A perfect reflection of its world: brutal, fetal, and lacking truth."\n—Oracle en-Vec

name: Leeching Licid
text: {B}, {T}: Leeching Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {B} to end this effect.\nAt the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Leeching Licid deals 1 damage to that player.

name: Legacy's Allure
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a treasure counter on Legacy's Allure.\nSacrifice Legacy's Allure: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of treasure counters on Legacy's Allure. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Legerdemain
text: Exchange control of target artifact or creature and another target permanent that shares one of those types with it. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
flavor: Squee tucked the warm ball in his pocket and slipped a pebble in its place. ‘Glok,' he mumbled, and hid.

name: Light of Day
text: Black creatures can't attack or block.
flavor: "I do not miss sunlight. The very memory of it burns my eyes."\n—Volrath

name: Lightning Blast
text: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: "Those who fear the darkness have never seen what the light can do."\n—Selenia, dark angel

name: Lightning Elemental
text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor: A lightning elemental once killed an entire tribe of merfolk—simply by going for a swim.

name: Living Death
text: Each player exiles all creature cards from his or her graveyard, then sacrifices all creatures he or she controls, then puts all cards he or she exiled this way onto the battlefield.

name: Lobotomy
text: Target player reveals his or her hand, then you choose a card other than a basic land card from it. Search that player's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as the chosen card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Lotus Petal
text: {T}, Sacrifice Lotus Petal: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
flavor: "Hard to imagine," mused Hanna, stroking the petal, "such a lovely flower inspiring such greed."

name: Lowland Giant
flavor: "Faugh!" snorted Tahngarth. "Why would it make a meal of something like you?" Squee looked relieved. "No," he continued, "you'd make a much better toothpick."

name: Maddening Imp
text: Flying\n{T}: Non-Wall creatures the active player controls attack this turn if able. At the beginning of the next end step, destroy each of those creatures that didn't attack this turn. Activate this ability only during an opponent's turn and only before combat.

name: Magmasaur
text: Magmasaur enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a +1/+1 counter from Magmasaur. If you don't, sacrifice Magmasaur and it deals damage equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on it to each creature without flying and each player.

name: Magnetic Web
text: If a creature with a magnet counter on it attacks, all creatures with magnet counters on them attack if able.\nWhenever a creature with a magnet counter on it attacks, all creatures with magnet counters on them block that creature this turn if able.\n{1}, {T}: Put a magnet counter on target creature.

name: Mana Severance
text: Search your library for any number of land cards and exile them. Then shuffle your library.
flavor: "And when this land is wasted, where will we go?"\n—Thalakos lament

name: Manakin
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
flavor: Hanna regarded Squee sternly. "Because it's not a toy, no matter how much it may look like one," she said, taking the manakin from him.

name: Manta Riders
text: {U}: Manta Riders gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: "Water is firmament to the finned."\n—Oracle en-Vec

name: Marble Titan
text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
flavor: "Strapping on nine hundred pounds of armor every morning would make any warrior cross."\n—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Marsh Lurker
text: Sacrifice a Swamp: Marsh Lurker gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor: From the mists it rises, into the mists it retreats; through the mists it walks, fearless and unseen.

name: Master Decoy
text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
flavor: "A skilled decoy can throw your enemies off your trail. A master decoy can survive to do it again."\n—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Mawcor
text: Flying\n{T}: Mawcor deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: From its maw comes neither word nor whisper—only wind.

name: Maze of Shadows
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Untap target attacking creature with shadow. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

name: Meditate
text: Draw four cards. You skip your next turn.
flavor: "Part of me believes that Barrin taught me meditation simply to shut me up."\n—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Metallic Sliver
flavor: When the clever counterfeit was accepted by the hive, Volrath's influence upon the slivers grew even stronger.

name: Mindwhip Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: Target player discards a card at random. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery."
flavor: "They share more than their thoughts. We must shatter their link quickly!"\n—Hanna, to Orim

name: Minion of the Wastes
text: Trample\nAs Minion of the Wastes enters the battlefield, pay any amount of life.\nMinion of the Wastes's power and toughness are each equal to the life paid as it entered the battlefield.

name: Mirri's Guile
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
flavor: Hanna was astounded. Mirri read every leaf and wisp of breeze like a book of ancient lore.

name: Mnemonic Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: Draw a card."
flavor: "A jigsaw puzzle that lives, breeds, and thinks."\n—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

name: Mogg Cannon
text: {T}: Target creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: Moggs never volunteer for anything twice.

name: Mogg Conscripts
text: Mogg Conscripts can't attack unless you've cast a creature spell this turn.
flavor: "Torahn's horns! They've seen us. Now, statue, you must fight to save yourself!"\n—Tahngarth, aboard the Predator

name: Mogg Fanatic
text: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: Mogg Fanatic deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: "I got it! I got it! I—"

name: Mogg Hollows
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Mogg Hollows doesn't untap during your next untap step.

name: Mogg Raider
text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: The evisceration of one mogg always cheers up the rest.

name: Mogg Squad
text: Mogg Squad gets -1/-1 for each other creature on the battlefield.
flavor: As they crept into the Weatherlight's hold, the squad leader held up his hand and whispered, "Stop, goblins—what's that sound?"

name: Mongrel Pack
text: When Mongrel Pack dies during combat, put four 1/1 green Hound creature tokens onto the battlefield.

name: Mounted Archers
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)\n{W}: Mounted Archers can block an additional creature this turn.

name: Muscle Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures get +1/+1.
flavor: The air was filled with the cracks and snaps of flesh hardening as the new sliver joined the battle.

name: Natural Spring
text: Target player gains 8 life.
flavor: Mirri listened intently, even as Hanna held the healing water to her lips. Would the sound of the spring drown out the elves' approach?

name: Nature's Revolt
text: All lands are 2/2 creatures that are still lands.
flavor: "One day the land will don the semblance of flesh and challenge even the plowshare's blade."\n—Oracle en-Vec

name: Needle Storm
text: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying.
flavor: The rain is driven like nails.

name: No Quarter
text: Whenever a creature becomes blocked by a creature with lesser power, destroy the blocking creature.\nWhenever a creature blocks a creature with lesser power, destroy the attacking creature.
flavor: As Gerrard and Greven neared each other, the moggs caught between them realized they should flee.

name: Nurturing Licid
text: {G}, {T}: Nurturing Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {G} to end this effect.\n{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature.

name: Opportunist
text: {T}: Opportunist deals 1 damage to target creature that was dealt damage this turn.
flavor: The third time the Oracle glanced suspiciously at him, Starke decided she had glanced twice too often.

name: Oracle en-Vec
text: {T}: Target opponent chooses any number of creatures he or she controls. During that player's next turn, the chosen creatures attack if able, and other creatures can't attack. At the beginning of that turn's end step, destroy each of the chosen creatures that didn't attack. Activate this ability only during your turn.

name: Orim, Samite Healer
text: {T}: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
flavor: "The silkworm spins itself a new existence. So the healer weaves the threads of life."\n—Orim, Samite healer

name: Orim's Prayer
text: Whenever one or more creatures attack you, you gain 1 life for each attacking creature.
flavor: "As usual, there will be time for prayer only after the worst happens."\n—Orim, Samite healer

name: Overrun
text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
flavor: "You want to know your enemy? Look at your feet while you trample him."\n—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

name: Pacifism
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature can't attack or block.
flavor: Frozen by conscience, Karn did not resist as the moggs carried him to the Predator.

name: Pallimud
text: As Pallimud enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.\nPallimud's power is equal to the number of tapped lands the chosen player controls.
flavor: The old Vec tell tales of a beast that fed on scraps but turned its nose up at the lavish banquet they set in its honor.

name: Patchwork Gnomes
text: Discard a card: Regenerate Patchwork Gnomes.
flavor: "Just when I get them working, they always start fighting and tearing at each other for spare parts."\n—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

name: Pearl Medallion
text: White spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

name: Pegasus Refuge
text: {2}, Discard a card: Put a 1/1 white Pegasus creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
flavor: The first Rath-born pegasus was so offended by the sky that it hid its eyes in the earth.\n—Vec lore

name: Perish
text: Destroy all green creatures. They can't be regenerated.
flavor: "There will come a time when the voices of soil and seedling will sing only laments."\n—Oracle en-Vec

name: Phyrexian Grimoire
text: {4}, {T}: Target opponent chooses one of the top two cards of your graveyard. Exile that card and put the other one into your hand.
flavor: Every page cost a life; every secret cost a thousand more.

name: Phyrexian Hulk
flavor: "They are convenient in having no souls, but less so in having no spirit."\n—Volrath

name: Phyrexian Splicer
text: {2}, {T}, Choose flying, first strike, trample, or shadow: Until end of turn, target creature with the chosen ability loses it and another target creature gains it.

name: Pincher Beetles
text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: "No fair! Since when does a bug get ta munch on me?"\n—Squee, goblin cabin hand

name: Pine Barrens
text: Pine Barrens enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool. Pine Barrens deals 1 damage to you.

name: Pit Imp
text: Flying\n{B}: Pit Imp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
flavor: The moans of the Death Pits were underscored by the chattering of imps, for whom the ship was cause for much discussion.

name: Power Sink
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands with mana abilities he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.

name: Precognition
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of target opponent's library. If you do, you may put that card on the bottom of that player's library.
flavor: A gleam like struggling sunlight penetrated Selenia's dark thoughts.

name: Propaganda
text: Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature he or she controls that's attacking you.
flavor: "You've failed Gerrard. You've failed the Legacy. You've failed yourself. I can do no more."\n—Volrath, to Karn

name: Puppet Strings
text: {2}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
flavor: "Have no illusions," Volrath warned Greven, "about free will."

name: Quickening Licid
text: {1}{W}, {T}: Quickening Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {W} to end this effect.\nEnchanted creature has first strike.

name: Rain of Tears
text: Destroy target land.
flavor: "These rains cannot quench; they carve the land's face like a scalpel on flesh."\n—Crovax

name: Rampant Growth
text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
flavor: Rath forces plants from its surface as one presses whey from cheese.

name: Ranger en-Vec
text: First strike\n{G}: Regenerate Ranger en-Vec.
flavor: "The path of least resistance will seldom lead you beyond your doorstep."\n—Oracle en-Vec

name: Rathi Dragon
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nWhen Rathi Dragon enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice two Mountains.
flavor: Wrap the flame as twine\nKingdoms will be thine.

name: Rats of Rath
text: {B}: Destroy target artifact, creature, or land you control.
flavor: "These creatures offer new challenges in the scrutiny of entrails."\n—Oracle en-Vec

name: Reality Anchor
text: Target creature loses shadow until end of turn.\nDraw a card.
flavor: "See how you like it."\n—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Reanimate
text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.
flavor: "You will learn to earn death."\n—Volrath

name: Reap
text: Return up to X target cards from your graveyard to your hand, where X is the number of black permanents target opponent controls as you cast Reap.
flavor: "Let Volrath choke on his crop of hatred."\n—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Reckless Spite
text: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.
flavor: "My plan's elegance leads my enemies to believe it is spite that fuels me."\n—Volrath

name: Recycle
text: Skip your draw step.\nWhenever you play a card, draw a card.\nYour maximum hand size is two.

name: Reflecting Pool
text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any type that a land you control could produce.
flavor: "The reflection of land interests me far more than its reality."\n—Volrath

name: Renegade Warlord
text: First strike\nWhenever Renegade Warlord attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "His tongue must be honey, the way he gathers ants to fight with him."\n—Volrath

name: Repentance
text: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.
flavor: "The cannon wasn't aimed at you!" pleaded Vhati.\n"I'm not sure which is more pathetic," replied Greven, "your judgment or your aim."

name: Respite
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. You gain 1 life for each attacking creature.
flavor: "If they board us we're finished," warned Orim. Crovax nodded. "And if they don't . . . what then?"

name: Rolling Thunder
text: Rolling Thunder deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
flavor: "Such rage," thought Vhati, gazing up at the thunderhead from the Predator. "It is Greven's mind manifest."

name: Root Maze
text: Artifacts and lands enter the battlefield tapped.
flavor: "We should step up repairs. I think the forest has plans for us."\n—Crovax

name: Rootbreaker Wurm
text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)
flavor: As Gerrard made his escape, the wurm covered his flight by helping itself to three great mouthfuls of merfolk.

name: Rootwalla
text: {1}{G}: Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
flavor: If you try to sneak up on a rootwalla, you'll suddenly find yourself dealing with twice the lizard.

name: Rootwater Depths
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Rootwater Depths doesn't untap during your next untap step.

name: Rootwater Diver
text: {T}, Sacrifice Rootwater Diver: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "Drop a dagger into the murky deep and the merfolk will cut your throat with it."\n—Skyshroud saying

name: Rootwater Hunter
text: {T}: Rootwater Hunter deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
flavor:
"Bitter water   vicious wave
Shadow-cold shallows   root-made maze
Home's angry embrace."
—Rootwater Saga

name: Rootwater Matriarch
text: {T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as that creature is enchanted.

name: Rootwater Shaman
text: You may cast Aura cards with enchant creature as though they had flash.
flavor: "Ugh! When did orcs and fish start having kids?"\n—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Ruby Medallion
text: Red spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

name: Sacred Guide
text: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Sacred Guide: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a white card. Put that card into your hand and exile all other cards revealed this way.

name: Sadistic Glee
text: Enchant creature\nWhenever a creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
flavor: "First blood isn't as important as last blood."\n—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Safeguard
text: {2}{W}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.
flavor: "I'm amused by wasted effort when it's not my own."\n—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

name: Salt Flats
text: Salt Flats enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool. Salt Flats deals 1 damage to you.

name: Sandstone Warrior
text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)\n{R}: Sandstone Warrior gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "I used to describe something stable as ‘rock solid.' So much for that expression."\n—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Sapphire Medallion
text: Blue spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

name: Sarcomancy
text: When Sarcomancy enters the battlefield, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no Zombies on the battlefield, Sarcomancy deals 1 damage to you.

name: Scabland
text: Scabland enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool. Scabland deals 1 damage to you.

name: Scalding Tongs
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have three or fewer cards in hand, Scalding Tongs deals 1 damage to target opponent.
flavor: "This has nothing to do with what you know and everything to do with what I wish."\n—Volrath

name: Scorched Earth
text: As an additional cost to cast Scorched Earth, discard X land cards.\nDestroy X target lands.
flavor: "Fire cleanses as well as destroys; that is the nature of change."\n—Oracle en-Vec

name: Scragnoth
text: Scragnoth can't be countered.\nProtection from blue
flavor: It possesses no intelligence, only counter-intelligence.

name: Screeching Harpy
text: Flying\n{1}{B}: Regenerate Screeching Harpy.
flavor: "They are called ‘fowl' for a reason."\n—Mirri of the Weatherlight

name: Scroll Rack
text: {1}, {T}: Exile any number of cards from your hand face down. Put that many cards from the top of your library into your hand. Then look at the exiled cards and put them on top of your library in any order.

name: Sea Monster
text: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
flavor: Water is life. Or perhaps it is just something to wash it down with.

name: Searing Touch
text: Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nSearing Touch deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

name: Seeker of Skybreak
text: {T}: Untap target creature.
flavor: "We shun them not for their dream but for their refusal to let such a noble dream die a noble death."\n—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Segmented Wurm
text: Whenever Segmented Wurm becomes the target of a spell or ability, put a -1/-1 counter on it.
flavor: "If only we could so easily leave behind those parts of ourselves that pain us."\n—Crovax

name: Selenia, Dark Angel
text: Flying\nPay 2 life: Return Selenia, Dark Angel to its owner's hand.
flavor: "I am light. I am dark. I must give my life to serve; not even death can release me."\n—Selenia, dark angel

name: Serene Offering
text: Destroy target enchantment. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
flavor: "A sacrifice made in peace is worth a dozen made in panic."\n—Orim, Samite healer

name: Servant of Volrath
text: When Servant of Volrath leaves the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
flavor: "Volrath is a harsh master. My reflection is a constant reminder of that."\n—Greven il-Vec

name: Shadow Rift
text: Target creature gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nDraw a card.

name: Shadowstorm
text: Shadowstorm deals 2 damage to each creature with shadow.
flavor: "You've not seen a storm until you've seen the kind that roars between worlds."\n—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Shatter
text: Destroy target artifact.
flavor: "Such fuss over machines, Gerrard. Remember that you are the prize of the Legacy. Throw away your toys!"\n—Orim, Samite healer

name: Shimmering Wings
text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)\nEnchanted creature has flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\n{U}: Return Shimmering Wings to its owner's hand.
flavor: The brighter the wings, the deeper the impact crater.

name: Shocker
text: Whenever Shocker deals damage to a player, that player discards all the cards in his or her hand, then draws that many cards.

name: Sky Spirit
text: Flying, first strike
flavor: "Like a strain of music: easy to remember but impossible to catch."\n—Mirri of the Weatherlight

name: Skyshroud Condor
text: Flying\nCast Skyshroud Condor only if you've cast another spell this turn.
flavor: Condor's flight augurs sleepless night.\n—Skyshroud proverb

name: Skyshroud Elf
text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.\n{1}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.
flavor: "It is our duty to endure."\n—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Skyshroud Forest
text: Skyshroud Forest enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool. Skyshroud Forest deals 1 damage to you.

name: Skyshroud Ranger
text: {T}: You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
flavor: "Just as you see the grave and remember the friend, I see this forest and remember Llanowar."\n—Mirri of the Weatherlight

name: Skyshroud Troll
text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Skyshroud Troll.
flavor: The elves and merfolk have nothing but bitterness for each other. The trolls, however, find them both rather tasty.

name: Skyshroud Vampire
text: Flying\nDiscard a creature card: Skyshroud Vampire gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: "If it tastes one drop of elvish blood I will cast it from the shroud to see it burn."\n—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Soltari Crusader
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\n{1}{W}: Soltari Crusader gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "Carry war to the Dauthi, no matter the way, no matter the world."\n—Soltari battle chant

name: Soltari Emissary
text: {W}: Soltari Emissary gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor: Alone at the portal, Ertai began his meditation. He realized immediately that he was not alone.

name: Soltari Foot Soldier
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor: "Children of the Ruins, raised to be warriors, know that life begins when another speaks their names."\n—Soltari Tales of Life

name: Soltari Guerrillas
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\n{0}: The next time Soltari Guerrillas would deal combat damage to an opponent this turn, it deals that damage to target creature instead.

name: Soltari Lancer
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nSoltari Lancer has first strike as long as it's attacking.
flavor: "In times of war the victors rarely save their best for last."\n—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Soltari Monk
text: Protection from black\nShadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor: "Prayer rarely explains."\n—Orim, Samite healer

name: Soltari Priest
text: Protection from red\nShadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor: "In Rath," the priest said, "there is even greater need for prayer."

name: Soltari Trooper
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nWhenever Soltari Trooper attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Dauthi blood is Soltari wine."\n—Soltari Tales of Life

name: Souldrinker
text: Pay 3 life: Put a +1/+1 counter on Souldrinker.
flavor: Don't drink and thrive.

name: Spell Blast
text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)
flavor: Call it the thinking mage's version of brute force.

name: Spike Drone
text: Spike Drone enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.\n{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Drone: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

name: Spinal Graft
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +3/+3.\nWhen enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: "This one has not screamed enough to show effective implantation. Kill it."\n—Volrath

name: Spirit Mirror
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no Reflection tokens on the battlefield, put a 2/2 white Reflection creature token onto the battlefield.\n{0}: Destroy target Reflection.

name: Spontaneous Combustion
text: As an additional cost to cast Spontaneous Combustion, sacrifice a creature.\nSpontaneous Combustion deals 3 damage to each creature.
flavor: "Heat of battle" is usually a metaphor.

name: Squee's Toy
text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
flavor: As the horrors closed in on Gerrard, Squee trembled and clutched his toy for comfort. He didn't know where it came from or why it was so warm, but he was glad he'd kept it near.

name: Stalking Stones
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{6}: Stalking Stones becomes a 3/3 Elemental artifact creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Starke of Rath
text: {T}: Destroy target artifact or creature. That permanent's controller gains control of Starke of Rath. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
flavor: "I know to whom I owe the most loyalty, and I see him in the mirror every day."\n—Starke

name: Static Orb
text: As long as Static Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than two permanents during their untap steps.
flavor: Time passes, time crawls;\nTime doesn't move at all.

name: Staunch Defenders
text: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
flavor: "Hold your position! Leave doubt for the dying!"\n—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

name: Steal Enchantment
text: Enchant enchantment\nYou control enchanted enchantment.
flavor: "Why should I flatter another with imitation when I can satisfy myself through possession?"\n—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Stinging Licid
text: {1}{U}, {T}: Stinging Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {U} to end this effect.\nWhenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, Stinging Licid deals 2 damage to that creature's controller.

name: Stone Rain
text: Destroy target land.
flavor: "The land shall beg for drink and curse the rain that follows."\n—Oracle en-Vec

name: Storm Front
text: {G}{G}: Tap target creature with flying.
flavor: The calmest day on Rath would be thought a storm anywhere else.

name: Stun
text: Target creature can't block this turn.\nDraw a card.
flavor: "I concede it was a cheap shot, but it was the only one I could afford."\n—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Sudden Impact
text: Sudden Impact deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.
flavor: The Predator roared like an unruly beast, and the Weatherlight suddenly listed. "No!" screamed Hanna.

name: Tahngarth's Rage
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +3/+0 as long as it's attacking. Otherwise, it gets -2/-1.
flavor: "Taste my horns!"\n—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

name: Talon Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have first strike.
flavor: "Keep them at sword's length!" Gerrard's order fell flat as each sliver's talon suddenly grew longer. "Hold on—break out the polearms!"

name: Telethopter
text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Telethopter gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: After losing several of the devices to midair collisions, Greven forbade moggs from operating telethopters.

name: Thalakos Dreamsower
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nYou may choose not to untap Thalakos Dreamsower during your untap step.\nWhenever Thalakos Dreamsower deals damage to an opponent, tap target creature. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Thalakos Dreamsower remains tapped.

name: Thalakos Lowlands
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool. Thalakos Lowlands doesn't untap during your next untap step.

name: Thalakos Mistfolk
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\n{U}: Put Thalakos Mistfolk on top of its owner's library.
flavor: "They are ‘between' in every way."\n—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Thalakos Seer
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)\nWhen Thalakos Seer leaves the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor: "You see our world when you shut your eyes so tightly that tiny shapes float before them."\n—Lyna, to Ertai

name: Thalakos Sentry
text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor: "Ill luck and poor geography caught the Thalakos between us and the Dauthi."\n—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Thumbscrews
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have five or more cards in hand, Thumbscrews deals 1 damage to target opponent.
flavor: "We will start small, I think."\n—Volrath

name: Time Ebb
text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
flavor: "Gone today, here tomorrow."\n—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Time Warp
text: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.
flavor: "Let's do it again!"\n—Squee, goblin cabin hand

name: Tooth and Claw
text: Sacrifice two creatures: Put a 3/1 red Beast creature token named Carnivore onto the battlefield.
flavor: "You deify nature as female—kind and gentle—yet you cringe at what is natural."\n—Mirri of the Weatherlight

name: Torture Chamber
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a pain counter on Torture Chamber.\nAt the beginning of your end step, Torture Chamber deals damage to you equal to the number of pain counters on it.\n{1}, {T}, Remove all pain counters from Torture Chamber: Torture Chamber deals damage to target creature equal to the number of pain counters removed this way.

name: Tradewind Rider
text: Flying\n{T}, Tap two untapped creatures you control: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor: It is said that the wind will blow the world past if you wait long enough.

name: Trained Armodon
flavor: These are its last days. Better to grow broad and heavy. Better that the enemy is crushed beneath its carcass.

name: Tranquility
text: Destroy all enchantments.
flavor: "Peace will come, but whether born of harmony or entropy I cannot say."\n—Oracle en-Vec

name: Trumpeting Armodon
text: {1}{G}: Target creature blocks Trumpeting Armodon this turn if able.
flavor: These are its last days. But it will not go quietly.

name: Twitch
text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.\nDraw a card.
flavor: Battles are won in nuance.

name: Unstable Shapeshifter
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, Unstable Shapeshifter becomes a copy of that creature and gains this ability.
flavor: "In a world of untruths, the living lie rules."\n—Oracle en-Vec

name: Vec Townships
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Vec Townships doesn't untap during your next untap step.

name: Verdant Force
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
flavor: Burl, scurf, and bower\nBirth fern and flower.

name: Verdigris
text: Destroy target artifact.
flavor: "Only the most sophisticated inventions can survive nature's unsophisticated motivations."\n—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

name: Vhati il-Dal
text: {T}: Until end of turn, target creature has base power 1 or base toughness 1.
flavor: "Sir, I just thought . . . ," explained Vhati.\n"Don't think," interrupted Greven. "It doesn't suit you."

name: Volrath's Curse
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated. That creature's controller may sacrifice a permanent for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.\n{1}{U}: Return Volrath's Curse to its owner's hand.

name: Wall of Diffusion
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\nWall of Diffusion can block creatures with shadow as though Wall of Diffusion had shadow.
flavor: "The injury was being caught between this world and our own; the insult was to find walls within."\n—Lyna, Soltari emissary

name: Warmth
text: Whenever an opponent casts a red spell, you gain 2 life.
flavor: "Flame grows gentle with but a little distance."\n—Orim, Samite healer

name: Wasteland
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}, Sacrifice Wasteland: Destroy target nonbasic land.
flavor: "The land promises nothing and keeps its promise."\n—Oracle en-Vec

name: Watchdog
text: Watchdog blocks each turn if able.\nAs long as Watchdog is untapped, all creatures attacking you get -1/-0.
flavor: Its growl is a long, rumbling grind of gears and clockwork, its bark a blast of hissing steam.

name: Whim of Volrath
text: Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nChange the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another until end of turn. (For example, you may change "nonred creature" to "nongreen creature" or "plainswalk" to "swampwalk.")

name: Whispers of the Muse
text: Buyback {5} (You may pay an additional {5} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nDraw a card.
flavor: "I followed her song only to find it was a dirge."\n—Crovax

name: Wild Wurm
text: When Wild Wurm enters the battlefield, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, return Wild Wurm to its owner's hand.
flavor:
Wurm heads appear
Wild wurm near
Wurm tails you see
Wild wurm flee

name: Wind Dancer
text: Flying\n{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: "Flying like a bird does not make you as free as one."\n—Volrath

name: Wind Drake
text: Flying
flavor: Orim regarded Gerrard coolly. "You are like the drake," she said, her expression unchanging. "It works hard to maintain its position, but to us it seems to glide along effortlessly. You must do the same."

name: Winds of Rath
text: Destroy all creatures that aren't enchanted. They can't be regenerated.
flavor: "There shall be a vast shout and then a vaster silence."\n—Oracle en-Vec

name: Winged Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have flying.
flavor: "Everything around here has cut a deal with gravity."\n—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Winter's Grasp
text: Destroy target land.
flavor: Summer is buried there, centuries deep;\nA crypt of years where seasons sleep.

name: Wood Sage
text: {T}: Name a creature card. Reveal the top four cards of your library and put all of them with that name into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.

name: Worthy Cause
text: Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)\nAs an additional cost to cast Worthy Cause, sacrifice a creature.\nYou gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.
